chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Peyton Mayo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court reads-in and dismisses Counts 1, 2, 5, 6 and 7.
Court reads-in and dismisses 14CM94.
Probation to run concurrent.
Court notes 138 days credit if revoked.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes: $2915.20 to be collected through DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #14CF197.

$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #14CF197.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #14CF197.
Not to use or possess firearms.

-No Contact with Lila Rudawski.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge R. Michael Waterman March 17, 2016 - amend credit.

-Run concurrent with Count 4 and Eau Claire County Case #15CF632.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 4 and 15CF632

superMiscConds.notes:
-All outstanding financial obligations to be converted into a civil judgment.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Jeremy Peyton Mayo appeared from jail. Case called at 3:54 p.m. Court notes revocation warrant and summary in file. Both parties have reviewed summary and no corrections to be made. ADA McKinley makes statement and recites recommendations. Has complied with victims rights. Atty Perrin gives sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Appeal to be filed in 20 days. Court orders:

Count 3:

- Total sentence 3 1/2 years. Concurrent to Count 4.
  - I/C 1 year 6 months
  - E/S 2 years

Count 4:

- Total sentence 3 1/2 years
  -I/C 1 year 6 months
  -E/S 2 years

- All outstanding financial obligations to be converted to a civil judgment.
- DNA Sample
- 269 days credit
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
- Eligible for CIP and Substance Abuse Programs. 
- Run concurrent to Eau Claire Co. Case 15CF632.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kevin Gehler  DF ATTY:  Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp   DF:  Jeremy Peyton Mayo appeared.  Ms. Sonnenberg from the DOC.  Court called at 3:02 p.m.  Scheduled for sentencing.  Includes 14CF197 & 14CM94.  ADA Gehler makes statement.  Attorneys have had a chance to review the PSI.  DE was found guilty of Ct 3 and Ct. 4 in 14CF197. On motion of the State, Crt dismissed but read in for purposes of restitution Ct 1, Ct. 2, Ct. 5, Ct. 6, & Ct. 7  in 14CF197 and 14CM94.  Attorneys make arguments.  Crt orders:  

14CF197 on Ct. 3
-S/W 3 years probation to run concurrent with 14CF197 on Ct. 4
- 90 days conditional time
- 16 Session AODA with follow through
- No firearms
  No Contact with Lila Rudawski
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250 for DNA Surcharge payable through the DOC
- Restitution to St. Croix County Sheriff's office of $2,915.20 payable through the DOC
- Restitution to Lila Rudawski for $2,695.00 payable through the DOC

14CF197 on Ct. 4
-S/W 3 years probation to run concurrent with 14CF197 on Ct. 3
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- 16 Session AODA with follow through
- No firearms
  No Contact with Lila Rudawski
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250 for DNA Surcharge payable through the DOC
- Restitution to St. Croix County Sheriff's office of $2,915.20 payable through the DOC
- Restitution to Lila Rudawski for $2,695.00 payable through the DOC

-138 credit for good time if revoked.     
-20 days to appeal

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb.  ADA: Kevin H. Gehler DF ATTY: Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp DF: Jeremy Peyton Mayo appeared from jail.  Court called at 10:46 a.m.   Includes case 14CF197 & 14CM94.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 3 and Ct. 4 in 14CF197. Crt informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 3 and Ct. 4 in 14CF197. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses but reads in for purposes of restitution Ct 1, Ct. 2, Ct. 5, Ct. 6, & Ct. 7  in 14CF197 and 14CM94. Court orders a PSI.  Attorney Kemp argues a bond modification.  ADA Gehler objects and makes arguments.  Court denies.  Court adjourned at 11:00 p.m. lw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Plea hearing on October 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.
